abstracts.cdata!:
This Indigenous Peoples Plan (IPP) for
            the Primary Education for Disadvantaged Children Project
            identifies ethnic minority issues, summarized as
            difficulties in accessing education due to long distances,
            or late enrollments; persistent incomplete schooling due to
            high costs, or non-supportive environment to attend school,
            namely, sibling care in ethnic minority areas, or child
            labor demands; and, low performance quality resulting from
            non-supportive instructional environments, lack of
            instructional materials, and a highly condensed curriculum.
            Through project interventions, this IPP stipulates measures
            to involve ethnic minorities in attending schools, and
            participating in the educational achievements. Community
            mobilization will prod school attendance, and foster
            community training to improve school enrollment at the
            district level, by supporting the provision of free
            textbooks and supplies, supporting Vietnamese language
            readiness programs, and improving training of local
            teachers, in addition to quality improvements at satellite
            schools, which should result in enhanced educational quality
            between main campuses and satellite schools. Direct
            educational costs should be alleviated through fee waivers
            for books, and supplies, as well as community-supported
            language-readiness pre-schooling should ease the burden of
            sibling care, or child labor difficulties. Finally, the
            national curriculum standards should be evenly applied, but
            be relevant, and culturally appropriate to ethnic
            minorities, in accord with educational materials.
